subclusters.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
Mitochondrial Dysfunction and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
Autophagy Decline and Cellular Renewal Failure Theory
Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA damage response activation, p53/p21/pRb pathways, and ROS feedback loops as primary mechanisms inducing senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes p53/pRb cooperation in stress-induced premature senescence independent of telomere shortening, highlighting DNA damage response pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links p53 activation from DNA damage/telomere shortening to fatty acid metabolism changes driving senescence, fitting DNA damage response mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes p53/p66Shc oxidative stress response pathway linking DNA damage and ROS to senescence and aging, fitting DNA damage and stress response theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on tumor suppressor pathways (p53, p16INK4a, Rb) regulating senescence induction and maintenance in response to DNA damage and oncogenic stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence triggered by tumor suppressor pathways responding to DNA damage, oxidative stress, telomere attrition, and oncogenic signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights tumor suppressors p16ink4a, p53, and p19/p14arf mediating senescence and regenerative decline via DNA damage and telomere shortening.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence as a programmed stress response involving DNA damage response, cell cycle arrest, and SASP secretion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links premature cellular senescence in progeroid syndromes to DNA damage and regenerative tissue aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits accumulation of senescent cells driven by DNA damage and stress as causal for organismal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening and DNA damage as triggers of stable cell cycle arrest and SASP contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes stress-induced premature senescence (SIPS) caused by subcytotoxic stress leading to DNA damage and senescence distinct from replicative senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS, and SASP secretion as drivers of senescence and inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction-associated senescence (MiDAS) and SASP contributing to inflammaging and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes cellular senescence as nexus linking subcellular damage including mitochondrial damage to organismal aging via SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cells secreting SASP factors and mitochondrial ROS driving chronic inflammation and tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative stress and DNA damage inducing senescence and SASP, with impaired immune clearance exacerbating accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell accumulation and SASP secretion driving tissue dysfunction and age-related diseases like osteoarthritis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence as tumor suppressive but detrimental with SASP secretion causing chronic inflammation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details senescent cell accumulation, SASP secretion, and their role in cardiovascular aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Microglial Senescence and Immune Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on microglial senescence, immune exhaustion, and neuroinflammation driving brain aging and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Renewal Failure Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related decline in autophagy leading to accumulation of damaged proteins and organelles, promoting senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Renewal Failure Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on macroautophagy decline with age and its restoration by caloric restriction or drugs to extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Renewal Failure Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details nutrient-sensing regulation of autophagy decline in aging and genetic evidence linking autophagy to longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence driven by telomere shortening and its evolutionary role in tumor suppression linked to body size.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative senescence in stem/progenitor cells linked to aging, with telomere shortening as a partial but not sole cause.
